head.title: Stacey J. Byer and Craig L. Farlie

hedline.hl1: Stacey J. Byer and Craig L. Farlie

block.p: Stacey Jane Byer, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Norman E. Byer of Columbia, Md., was married yesterday to Craig Leitzow Farlie, a son of Mr. and Mrs. William N. Farlie Jr. of Upper Montclair, N.J. The Rev. Charles Beirne, a Roman Catholic priest, and Cantor Judi Porecki jointly officiated at Oxon Hill (Md.) Manor.

The bride and the bridegroom, both 26, graduated from Princeton University. Mrs. Farlie is an admissions officer there. Her father is an associate director of microelectronics for Martin Marietta Laboratories, an aerospace research and development center in Baltimore. Her mother, Eleanor D. Byer, was until recently an accountant for the United Way in Baltimore.

Stacey Jane Byer, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Norman E. Byer of Columbia, Md., was married yesterday to Craig Leitzow Farlie, a son of Mr. and Mrs. William N. Farlie Jr. of Upper Montclair, N.J. The Rev. Charles Beirne, a Roman Catholic priest, and Cantor Judi Porecki jointly officiated at Oxon Hill (Md.) Manor.

The bride and the bridegroom, both 26, graduated from Princeton University. Mrs. Farlie is an admissions officer there. Her father is an associate director of microelectronics for Martin Marietta Laboratories, an aerospace research and development center in Baltimore. Her mother, Eleanor D. Byer, was until recently an accountant for the United Way in Baltimore.

Mr. Farlie is an associate in the corporate finance department of Blockbuster Entertainment Corporation in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. His mother, Barbara L. Farlie, an author of books on crafts, is a partner in the Finders Design Associates Inc., an interior design concern in Montclair, N.J. His father is a partner of Gilbert, Farlie Inc. in New York, a management consulting concern to the advertising industry.
